treatment.description: Herbs, compactly matted, 0.1–0.3(–0.6) × 0.5–3 dm, mostly thinly tomentose. Leaves: blade elliptic, 0.1–0.25 × 0.06–0.12 cm. Inflorescences capitate or nearly so; branches absent or slender. Involucres (0.8–)1–1.7(–2) mm. Flowers (1.5–)2–2.5 mm; perianth white to pink. Achenes 1.5–2 mm.
treatment.habitat: gravelly to rocky granitic talus slopes
treatment.discussion: Variety olanchense is known only from Olancha Peak, Tulare County. It is worthy of cultivation as a rock-garden plant. In Baja California, var. oresbium Reveal is similar; that taxon is restricted to the Sierra Juárez and Sierra San Pedro Martír, but already has made its appearance as a cultivated rock-garden plant.
